HOME.TITLE: BlitzBasicScript
HOME.SUBTITLE: Easy Game Programming

INFO_1.HEADER: Do you want to learn how to program games?
INFO_1.BODY:
Then you are right here.

Perhaps you read somewhere that it would be very exhausting and time-consuming to write your own computer games. You would have to learn a complicated programming language first, deal with a lot of math and take months to produce small graphic demos. But that's not true.

HOME.INFO_3:
At least if you do it right.

With BlitzBasicScript you will discover the fascination of game development in a playful way from the very first minute. Are you curious and want to explore all the cool ways you can create living virtual worlds? Twelve tutorials are waiting for you, in which you will learn in no time how to conjure up graphics on the screen, play sound effects and move 3D objects.

Or do you want to get started right away without getting bored with any theory? Then just open a demo project of your choice and try it out! Use the integrated development environment to examine the code line by line and change things as you like. In this way, you can quickly and intuitively see how a computer game works under the hood - learning by doing.

And if you do reach your limits and don't know what to do next, no problem: Simply mark a code area and activate the coding guide. It will help you better understand commands and keywords and comprehend the underlying mechanisms.

REASON_1.BODY: BlitzBasicScript is a further development of the legendary game programming language BlitzBasic, which was invented by the New Zealand computer scientist Mark Sibly. The syntax - the way commands and code structures look - is very easy to read and understand. You don't have to learn abstract concepts, just write line by line in your program what exactly should happen. Draw a picture on the monitor, play background music, make the figure jump up when you click the space bar!

REASON_2.BODY: You don't have to install programs or buy licenses to create your games. All you need is a browser and an internet connection. Use the integrated development environment (Online IDE) to write and manage your source code. If you have a free account at blitzbasicscript.com, you can access your projects from any device and share them with the community.

REASON_3.HEADER: Lots of Examples, Tutorials and Documentation
REASON_3.BODY: Why start from scratch instead of having fun? Forget about colorless text or maths treatises - start trying small pre-built games and researching their code right away. In no time at all, you'll learn what to do to bring your creative ideas to life without reinventing the wheel. A small collection of clear tutorials will help you to understand the basic principles of game programming and to apply them directly. And if you want to know exactly, take a look at the extensive documentation of the commands and keywords!

REASON_4.BODY: At the beginning of the new millennium, three programming languages ​​appeared with BlitzBasic, Blitz3D and BlitzPlus, which essentially have a lot in common. Creative 2D and 3D games can be developed with just a few commands. The so-called Blitz languages ​​were very successful internationally and hundreds of games were created, whose source code often still exists today. All the advantages of these languages ​​have been bundled in BlitzBasicScript and enhanced with the help of the latest graphics technology. You can also simply import the old classics on blitzbasicscript.com and play them directly in your browser!

REASON_5.BODY: BlitzBasicScript is completely open source and the source code of this project can be viewed or used on GitHub. All you have to do is register for free and accept the terms of use to be able to save your projects in the cloud. Our philosophy is maximum freedom for all game developers: Benefit from the knowledge of others and in return make your projects available to the community. So everyone can learn and discover new things again and again. By the way, you always own the copyright to your games!

REASON_6.BODY: Make programming your own game: Register for free with BlitzBasicScript and become part of a lively community! Learn about new commands & data structures and incorporate them into your code to receive valuable trophies and medals. You can also take part in cool competitions and compete with others. In this way you improve your skills continuously and easily.

CONTACT.LABEL: Contact
CONTACT.SUBTITLE:
Do you want to get rid of praise or criticism for BlitzBasicScript? Did you find a bug on this website or while running your programs? Or do you just want to tell us something?


Then write us a message using the contact form. All personal information is voluntary and is subject to the GDPR. We only need your email address to answer you.

MESSAGE.LABEL: Message
MESSAGE.PLACEHOLDER: Please write a few sentences about your request.

CONTACT.DATA_AGREEMENT: I consent to my personal details being transmitted to BlitzBasicScript in accordance with the <abbr title="General Data Protection Regulation">GDPR</abbr>.
CONTACT.DATA_AGREEMENT_MUST_BE_ACCEPTED: You have to confirm the data protection declaration before sending your message.

SUCCESSFUL.TITLE: Your message has been sent
SUCCESSFUL.MESSAGE: Thank you for your message. You will shortly receive an answer by email.

ERROR.TITLE: An error has occurred
ERROR.MESSAGE: Unfortunately your message could not be sent. Please try again later.

LANDING.TEXT_01: BlitzBasicScript is a simple yet powerful programming language with which you can program your own games.

KEYWORDS.TITLE: Keywords
KEYWORDS.HEADLINE: Keywords are used to control the program flow and to declare variables, arrays, functions and types.

VARIABLES.TITLE: Variables
VARIABLES.HEADLINE: Learn about the different types of variables in BBScript and how they work.

SELECTIONS.TITLE: Conditions and Selection
SELECTIONS.HEADLINE: With the help of conditions and selection blocks, you control the program flow depending on the current status.

DATA_BLOCKS.TITLE: Arrays and Data Blocks
DATA_BLOCKS.HEADLINE: Arrays are storage fields in which a large amount of data can be easily managed. Data blocks can be used to make complex information such as level content quickly available.

LOOPS.TITLE: Loops
LOOPS.HEADLINE: Loops are intended to execute certain sections of code several times.
LOOPS.SUBTITLE: To execute commands multiple times in a row, you can choose between three different types of loops in BBScript.

FUNCTIONS.TITLE: Functions
FUNCTIONS.HEADLINE: Functions help you break your code down into logical sections.

TYPES.TITLE: Types
TYPES.HEADLINE: Use types to create any number of game objects at runtime.

MATHS.TITLE: Logic and Math
MATHS.HEADLINE: Logical operators are used to link several conditions with one another.

DIVERSE.TITLE: Diverse
DIVERSE.HEADLINE: Here you will find special keywords that do not fit into any other category.

DEPRECATED_KEYWORDS.TITLE: Deprecated Keywords
DEPRECATED_KEYWORDS.HEADLINE: Some deprecated keywords from BlitzBasic are not supported in BBScript.

COMMANDS.TITLE: Commands
COMMANDS.HEADLINE: Commands are predefined procedures that bring your games to life.
COMMANDS.SUBTITLE:
BlitzBasicScript besitzt über 700 Befehle zur Spielsteuerung. Sie sind alle sortiert nach Kategorien, welche wiederum aus verschiedenen Anwendungsbereichen bestehen.

Wähle aus der linken Navigationsleiste eine Kategorie aus, um die dazugehörigen Anwendungsbereiche zu öffnen, oder nutze die Suchfunktion, um einen bestimmten Begriff zu finden.

DEPRECATED_COMMANDS.TITLE: Obsolete Befehle
DEPRECATED_COMMANDS.HEADLINE: Hier findest du alle Befehle, welche zwar in BlitzBasic existieren, aber nicht in BBScript.

CONSTANTS_AND_SCANCODES.TITLE: Constants and Scancodes
CONSTANTS_AND_SCANCODES.HEADLINE: Nutze die speziellen Codes kennen für Tasteneingaben, Kameraeinstellungen, GUI-Events und vieles mehr.

DIFFERENCES_TO_BLITZBASIC.TITLE: Unterschiede zu BlitzBasic
DIFFERENCES_TO_BLITZBASIC.HEADLINE: Falls du schon Erfahrung mit BlitzBasic hast, lernst du hier die kleinen, aber feinen Unterschiede von BlitzBasicScript.

JETZT_LERNE_ICH: Jetzt lerne ich Spiele programmieren mit BlitzBasic
MISSION_SUBTITLE: BlitzBasicScript ist eine einfache und gleichzeitig mächtige Skriptsprache, die auf der BlitzBasic-Syntax aufbaut. Dank BlitzBasicScript kannst du mit minimalem Aufwand Spiele entwickeln, welche auf jedem beliebigen Gerät ganz einfach im Webbrowser gespielt werden können. Von simplen Knobelspielen bis hin zu aufwändigen 3D-Shootern ist alles möglich!

WORK_IN_PROGRESS.TITLE: Projektzustand: Alpha 0.0.1
WORK_IN_PROGRESS.TEXT: Momentan befindet sich BlitzBasicScript noch in der Alpha-Phase. Das bedeutet, auf dieser Website gibt es erstmal nur wenige Features und auch unter der Haube werden noch zahlreiche Befehle implementiert.

1.TITLE: More Than 700 Powerful Commands
1.MESSAGE: Create living 3D worlds, give your virtual environment the right sound and build an intuitive <abbr title="Graphical user interface">GUI</abbr> with just a few commands. A total of more than 700 commands - from 2D and 3D to data processing and game control - offer you a comfortable programming experience.

2.TITLE: Modern Graphics Engine
2.MESSAGE: Thanks to the latest version of BabylonJS you will experience unprecedented graphic power in your browser, even on mobile devices.

3.TITLE: Platform Independence
3.MESSAGE: Einmal coden, überall zocken: Deine Spiele lassen sich in jedem modernen Webbrowser ausführen. Es gibt keinerlei altmodische OS-Beschränkungen und du musst nichts weiter tun, als auf deinem Endgerät einen Web-Browser zu starten und auf blitzbasicscript.com zu gehen.

4.TITLE: Online <abbr title="Integrated development environment">IDE</abbr>
4.MESSAGE: Develop your games quickly and easily, wherever you are. All you need is an account at blitzbasicscript.com and an internet connection and you're ready to go!

5.TITLE: Numerous Assets Completely Free
5.MESSAGE: Vorbei die Zeit, als du jedes Bild selbst malen und Geräusche aufnehmen musstest: In der BlitzBasicScript-Cloud findest du hunderte Tilesets, 3D-Modelle, Sounds und Hintergrundmusiken sowie Schriftarten und vieles mehr. Natürlich kannst du trotzdem beliebig viele eigene Assets in deinen Projekten verwenden.

6.TITLE: New Edition Of The Legendary BlitzBasic
6.MESSAGE: A few years ago BlitzBasic was an insider tip among hobby game developers. With BlitzBasicScript you can now breathe new life into the countless earlier BB games in the browser: The syntax is almost identical, so you only have to copy the code of a BlitzBasic program into the online IDE and press play!

7.TITLE: Realistic Shadow Display And Physics Effects
7.MESSAGE: Some brand new commands extend classic BlitzBasic games with the possibility of physically correct lighting of 3D objects and of casting shadows on each other and on the floor. In addition, physics can be assigned to each 3D object in order to make the gaming experience as realistic as possible.

8.TITLE: Open Source Project
8.MESSAGE: The entire BlitzBasicScript project including lexer, parser, renderer and all game services is published as an Angular library under the MIT license and can be downloaded from GitHub.

9.TITLE: Long-Term Support
9.MESSAGE: 2020 is just the beginning: never before has it been possible to smoothly display games of the highest quality in a web browser. BlitzBasicScript offers modern, future-oriented hobby game developers an ideal alternative to Unity or C++. This project will be continuously developed in the next few years and thanks to advancing standards and hardware developments, game development in the browser will become the new standard.

PROJECT.TITLE: Projekttitel
PROJECT.TITLE_TOO_SHORT: Der Projekttitel ist zu kurz, bitte gib mindestens zwei Zeichen ein
PROJECT.TITLE_TOO_LONG: Der Projekttitel ist zu lang, bitte beschränke dich auf max. 32 Zeichen
PROJECT.TITLE_MUST_BE_ALPHANUMERIC: Der Projekttitel muss alphanumerisch sein (erlaubte Zeichen sind Buchstaben, Zahlen und Leerzeichen)
PROJECT.DESCRIPTION_PLACEHOLDER: Worum geht es in deinem Projekt? Mach ein bisschen Werbung und schreibe hier ein paar Sätze über das Spielziel, die Features und mehr.
